meanings.definition: To form or associate in a clique.
meanings.sent1: She enjoys cliquing with her close friends during lunch.
meanings.sent2: The students were cliquing together in the cafeteria.
meanings.sent3: The cats were cliquing in the sun, forming a cozy group.
meanings.sent4: The flowers in the garden seemed to be cliquing, creating a colorful display.
meanings.sent5: The birds were cliquing on the branches, chirping happily.

meanings.definition: The act of forming a clique.
meanings.sent1: Her participation in the cliquing at school made her feel included.
meanings.sent2: The cliquing among the employees was evident during the team-building activity.
meanings.sent3: The cliquing of the puppies at the park was a sight to behold.
meanings.sent4: The cliquing of the clouds in the sky created interesting shapes.
meanings.sent5: The cliquing of the leaves in the wind was a peaceful sound.
